Category.description: Profiles of this category specify a security policy. The URI of such profiles has to be part of an Endpoint Description returned from the GetEndpoint service.
Category.name: Security

Category.description: Profiles of this category specify a complete functional set for an OPC UA Server. The URI of such profiles has to be part of a Software Certificate returned with the CreateSession service response.
Category.name: Server

Category.description: Profiles of this category specify a specific protocol mapping. The URI of such profiles has to be part of an Endpoint Description.
Category.name: Transport

ConformanceGroup.description: Defines ConformanceUnits for various features of the OPC UA AddressSpace.

ConformanceUnit.description: Support the NodeClasses with their Attributes and behaviour as defined in OPC UA Part 3. This includes for instance: Object, Object Type, Variable, Variable Type, References and Data Type
ConformanceUnit.name: Address Space Base

ConformanceGroup.description: Includes ConformanceUnits to Read or Write current or historical Attribute values.
ConformanceGroup.name: Attribute Services

ConformanceUnit.description: Support the Read Service to read one or more Attributes of one or more Nodes. This includes support of the IndexRange parameter to read a single element or a range of elements when the Attribute value is an array
ConformanceUnit.name: Attribute Read

TestCase.description: Read: VALUE attribute of a single node.
TestCase.name: 001.js

TestCase.description: Read: Multiple attributes from a single node, in a single call.
TestCase.name: 002.js

TestCase.description: Read all available attributes from a single (valid) node, in a single call.
TestCase.name: 003.js

TestCase.description: Read multiple attributes from a valid node with maxAge = 0.
TestCase.name: 004.js

TestCase.description: Read a data value with TimestampsToReturn = BOTH
TestCase.name: 006.js

TestCase.description: Read a data value with timestampsToReturn = SOURCE. Lab: verify the source timestamp is returned.
TestCase.name: 007.js

TestCase.description: Read a data value with timestampsToReturn = SERVER. Lab: verify the Servers timestamp is returned.
TestCase.name: 008.js

TestCase.description: Read a data value with timestampsToReturn = NEITHER
TestCase.name: 009.js

TestCase.description: Read: BrowseName attribute from a valid node.
TestCase.name: 010.js

TestCase.description: Read: BrowseName attribute from multiple valid nodes.
TestCase.name: 011.js

TestCase.description: Read all available attributes from multiple valid nodes of each different node type, in a single call.
TestCase.name: 012.js

TestCase.description: Read: Same attribute from same node multiple times.
TestCase.name: 013.js

TestCase.description: Read: Data-type reads.
TestCase.name: 014.js

TestCase.description: Read: MaxAge > Int32
TestCase.name: 016.js

TestCase.description: Read: Read a single attribute that is not 'Value'. Cycle through AccessLevel, BrowseName, DataType, DisplayName, Historizing, NodeClass, NodeId, UserAccessLevel, ValueRank INDIVIDUALLY.
TestCase.name: 017.js

TestCase.description: Read: Read ServerStatus.State and verify == RUNNING_0.
TestCase.name: 018.js

TestCase.description: Read: Arrays of each data type (basic types)
TestCase.name: 022.js

TestCase.description: Read: Arrays of each data-type to be read from multiple Nodes in a single call.
TestCase.name: 023.js

TestCase.description: Read: Arrays, read one node of each data type specifying an IndexRange retrieving 2nd element only.
TestCase.name: 024.js

TestCase.description: Read: Arrays of various data types from multiple Nodes (in a single call) using IndexRange 2-4.
TestCase.name: 025.js

TestCase.description: Read: Arrays of various data types from multiple Nodes (in a single call) using IndexRange 'last 3 items'.
TestCase.name: 026.js

TestCase.description: Read: The EventNotifier attribute. Expects Good orBad_AttributeIdInvalid.
TestCase.name: 027.js

TestCase.description: Read attributes (not Value); sourceTimestamp=null; serverTimestamp is valid.
TestCase.name: 028.js

TestCase.description: Read the Value attribute of a single Node where the Value attribute is of a different data-type and is an multi dimensional array.
TestCase.name: 030.js

TestCase.description: Read the Value attribute of multiple nodes, each Node`s Value attribute is of a different data-type and is a multi-dimensionsal array.
TestCase.name: 031.js

TestCase.description: Use of IndexRange for reading a single element of a multi-dimensional array, in this case the 2nd element of the 2nd dimension.
TestCase.name: 032.js

TestCase.description: Use of IndexRange for reading a range of indexes of a multi-dimentional array, in this case a range is from 2-4 in the second dimension.
TestCase.name: 033.js

TestCase.description: Use of IndexRange for reading a range of indexes of a multi-dimentionsal array where the last 3 elements of the last dimension in the array are read for each data type.
TestCase.name: 034.js

TestCase.description: Read: Invalid (non-existent) attribute on a valid node. (Invalid attribute just happens to be "executable" in this case)
TestCase.name: Err-001.js

TestCase.description: Read: Multiple valid attributes and one invalid attribute, from a single valid node.
TestCase.name: Err-002.js

TestCase.description: Read: Invalid attribute from a valid node, multiple times in the same service call.
TestCase.name: Err-003.js

TestCase.description: Read: Valid attribute from an invaild (non existent) node.
TestCase.name: Err-004.js

TestCase.description: Read: Valid attribute from a node id with invalid syntax: String Id: Empty/null
TestCase.name: Err-005.js

TestCase.description: Read: Valid attribute from a node id with invalid syntax: Byte Id: Empty/null
TestCase.name: Err-006.js

TestCase.description: Read: Valid attributes (ids: 1, 3, 4, 5) from a set of nodes containing valid nodes, non-existent nodes, and nodes with invalid node id syntaxes
TestCase.name: Err-008.js

ConformanceUnit.description: Support alternate encoding when monitoring value Attributes. By default, every Server has to support the encoding of the currently used Stack Profile ( i.e. binary with UA Binary Encoding and XML with XML Encoding). This ConformanceUnit - when supported
ConformanceUnit.name: Monitor Alternate Encoding

ConformanceGroup.description: User level security includes support for security audit trails, with traceability between Client and Server audit logs.

ConformanceUnit.description: Note: Ensure that the CTT is configured to receive AuditEvents. It is recommended that AuditEvents are only provided for special users over a secure connection. Support AuditEvents. The list of supported AuditEvents shall be verified during certification testing and will be shown in the Certificate.

Profile.description: This security Facet defines a security policy for configurations with average security needs. It requires a PKI infrastructure. As computing power increases, security policies are expected to expire. NIST provides guidelines for expected expiration dates for individual algorithms. These guidelines provide recommended dates at which the algorithm should be replaced or upgraded to a more secure algorithm. They do not indicate a failure of the algorithm. This security policy has no published end dates as of this time. It is recommended that Servers and Clients support all security profiles and support configurability of actual exposed and default security policies.
Profile.name: SecurityPolicy - Aes128-Sha256-RsaOaep
